byline.original: By NICOLA CLARK and WILLIAM J. BROAD

abstract: Experts say that wreckage of Malaysia Airlines Flight 370, which vanished almost 17 months ago, will likely not be located even if debris that washed ashore on French island of Reunion in western Indian Ocean beach is proved to be from doomed flight; longer object is in water, more difficult to becomes to determine its point of origin due to surface winds and varying currents.
lead_paragraph: Even if the debris is authenticated as coming from the Malaysia Airlines jet, it may not help in locating the plane’s wreckage, experts said.

headline.main: Debris Alone May Not Solve Mystery of Malaysia Flight 370, Experts Say
headline.print_headline: Debris Alone Won’t Solve Malaysia Jet Mystery, Experts Say

snippet: Even if the debris is authenticated as coming from the Malaysia Airlines jet, it may not help in locating the plane’s wreckage, experts said.
